subject: Art & Design
title: What Is a Brand? Beyond the Logo
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is a Brand? Beyond the Logo usable.

hook.text: Nike's brand isn't the swoosh. It's the feeling of athletic ambition every time you see it. That feeling is the brand.

buildup.text: A brand is the total perception people hold about a company: values, emotions, reputation, and visual identity combined.

discovery.text: Jeff Bezos said: 'Your brand is what people say about you when you're not in the room.' It's reputation, not design.

twist.text: A stunning logo can't fix a broken reputation. Design communicates the brand â€” but the brand must exist first.

climax.text: Patagonia's brand is environmentalism. Every decision â€” materials, repairs, anti-Black Friday ads â€” reinforces it.

punchline.text: A logo is a symbol. A brand is a promise.

quiz.question: What is a brand according to Jeff Bezos' famous definition?
options: What people say about you when you're not in the room
Your company's logo and color scheme
The product you sell to customers
